episodeTitle: 100 Million Man! World's Greatest Power and Pirate Blackbeard
description: Luffy defeats Bellamy with a single devastating punch to recover Cricket's stolen gold. Meanwhile, at Mary Geoise, the Five Elders discuss world-changing events as the Warlords gather, and Blackbeard makes his first appearance.

voiceActorsJP.actor: Masato Hirano, Yasunori Masutani, Keiichi Noda, Kenichi Ogata, Keiichi Sonobe

events.title: Five Elders Debut
events.description: The Five Elders (Gorosei), the highest authority in the World Government, make their first appearance at Mary Geoise. They discuss the dangerous possibility of Red-Haired Shanks meeting with Whitebeard and the need to replace Crocodile as a Warlord.
events.significance: Introduces the series' ultimate authority figures who control the world from the shadows. This establishes the highest level of World Government power and foreshadows major conflicts to come.

quotes.text: If those two were to meet, it would be too dangerous.
quotes.speaker: Five Elders
quotes.context: Discussing Shanks and Whitebeard potentially meeting

events.title: Shanks Attempts to Contact Whitebeard
events.description: The Five Elders learn that Red-Haired Shanks is attempting to make contact with Whitebeard through a messenger. They recognize this meeting as potentially catastrophic and order it prevented.
events.significance: Foreshadows the importance of both Yonko and hints at major events to come. Establishes the World Government's fear of the Yonko working together.

events.title: Donquixote Doflamingo Debut
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo arrives at Mary Geoise for the Warlord meeting. He immediately demonstrates his Devil Fruit powers by forcing two Marines to fight each other for his amusement, showing his cruel nature.
events.significance: Introduces one of the series' most important antagonists and a future major arc villain. His casual cruelty and power establish him as a significant threat.

quotes.text: Fuffuffuffu! This is boring. Let's liven things up a bit.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo
quotes.context: Before making Marines fight each other

events.title: Bartholomew Kuma Debut
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma, another Warlord of the Sea, arrives at Mary Geoise for the emergency meeting. He carries his signature Bible and appears calm and silent.
events.significance: Introduces Kuma, who will become a pivotal character in multiple arcs, particularly Thriller Bark and Sabaody. His mysterious nature is established immediately.

events.title: Warlord Meeting Convenes
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku convenes an emergency meeting of the Seven Warlords of the Sea to find a replacement for the defeated Crocodile. Only three Warlords attend: Doflamingo, Kuma, and Mihawk.
events.significance: Shows the difficulty of controlling the Warlords and establishes their independent nature. Demonstrates the power balance system the World Government tries to maintain.

quotes.text: I'm impressed that even three of the remaining six Warlords showed up.
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Acknowledging the poor attendance at the mandatory meeting

events.title: Laffitte's Dramatic Entrance
events.description: Laffitte, a mysterious man with white wings, infiltrates the Warlord meeting at Mary Geoise undetected. He introduces himself as a former West Blue police officer exiled for his excessive violence.
events.significance: Demonstrates Laffitte's incredible stealth abilities and introduces the navigator of the Blackbeard Pirates. Shows how dangerous Blackbeard's crew is even before they're well-known.

quotes.text: I'm here to recommend my captain for the now-vacant position of Warlord.
quotes.speaker: Laffitte
quotes.context: Announcing his purpose for infiltrating the meeting

events.title: Marshall D. Teach Recommended as Warlord
events.description: Laffitte formally recommends his captain, Marshall D. Teach of the Blackbeard Pirates, to replace Crocodile as a Warlord. Sengoku admits he doesn't even know who this pirate is, but Laffitte assures him they're planning something big.
events.significance: First mention of Blackbeard's real name and his ambitions. Sets up his future importance and foreshadows his rapid rise to power. Shows his strategic thinking in targeting Warlord status.

quotes.text: My captain and crew are currently hatching a plan to make our names known throughout the world.
quotes.speaker: Laffitte
quotes.context: Explaining why Blackbeard isn't yet famous

events.title: Sarquiss Doubts Luffy's Bounty
events.description: In Mock Town, Sarquiss and other Bellamy Pirates discuss Luffy's new 100 million berry bounty poster, with Sarquiss insisting it must be a fake.
events.significance: Shows how shocking Luffy's bounty increase is to other pirates. Demonstrates the Bellamy Pirates' continued underestimation of the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: There's no way that weakling has a 100 million berry bounty! It has to be fake!
quotes.speaker: Sarquiss
quotes.context: Refusing to believe Luffy's bounty is real

events.title: Luffy Confronts Bellamy
events.description: Luffy arrives at the bar where Bellamy is celebrating. He calmly demands that Bellamy return Mont Blanc Cricket's gold that was stolen. Bellamy mocks him and refuses.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic confrontation between Luffy and Bellamy. Shows Luffy's growth in maturity and resolve compared to their first encounter.

quotes.text: You don't even know how to throw a punch, do you?
quotes.speaker: Bellamy

events.title: Bellamy's Spring Hopper Barrage
events.description: Bellamy uses his Spring Spring Fruit powers to launch a devastating Spring Hopper attack, bouncing off buildings and walls at incredible speed while attacking Luffy from all angles.
events.significance: Showcases Bellamy's Devil Fruit abilities in a real fight. Demonstrates his aerial combat style and the versatility of the Spring Spring Fruit.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Bellamy with One Punch
events.description: As Bellamy launches himself for a final Spring Hopper attack, Luffy times a single powerful downward punch perfectly, striking Bellamy and driving him through the floor. The impact leaves an imprint of Luffy's fist on Bellamy's face, knocking him out instantly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's overwhelming power growth since Alabasta. Shows he's on a completely different level than Bellamy, proving dreams and determination matter more than cynicism. This is one of the most satisfying moments in the Jaya arc.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: After defeating Bellamy, pointing upward to affirm his dream

events.title: Luffy Points to the Sky
events.description: After defeating Bellamy, Luffy retrieves Cricket's gold and points dramatically to the sky, silently reaffirming his belief in Sky Island and dreams in general. The defeated Bellamy Pirates watch in stunned silence.
events.significance: Iconic moment showing Luffy's conviction. Without words, he proves that dreams and belief are worth fighting for, directly contradicting everything Bellamy stood for.

events.title: Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) First Appearance
events.description: In Mock Town, a large mysterious man examines Luffy's bounty poster while citizens discuss Bellamy's defeat. He comments on Luffy's 100 million bounty with interest. This is the first physical appearance of Marshall D. Teach, also known as Blackbeard.
events.significance: The first appearance of one of the series' most important antagonists and Luffy's dark parallel. Blackbeard will become a Yonko and is directly connected to multiple major storylines including Ace's fate.

quotes.text: One hundred million, eh? That's quite impressive.
quotes.speaker: Blackbeard

events.title: Blackbeard: Not Interested in Weaklings
events.description: Blackbeard declares he's not interested in capturing weaklings, specifically stating he's after 'one man worth 100 million' but implying it's not Luffy. He and his crew discuss Laffitte and fate as they prepare to leave Mock Town.
events.significance: Foreshadows Blackbeard's true target and plan. References Laffitte being at Mary Geoise and hints at Blackbeard's grand scheme. Sets up his eventual confrontation with Ace.

quotes.text: I'm not interested in capturing weaklings. I'm after one man... one worth 100 million.
quotes.speaker: Blackbeard
quotes.context: Discussing his plans with his crew

events.title: Blackbeard Pirates Members Glimpsed
events.description: Brief appearances of Blackbeard's crew members: Doc Q (the sick doctor on horseback), Jesus Burgess (the wrestler), and Van Augur (the sniper). They discuss fate and destiny with their captain.
events.significance: Introduces key members of the Blackbeard Pirates who will become significant antagonists. Each member represents a dark parallel to a Straw Hat.

quotes.speaker: Van Augur
quotes.context: Discussing their philosophy with the crew

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: After defeating Bellamy, pointing upward to affirm belief in dreams

quotes.text: I'm not interested in capturing weaklings. I'm after one man... one worth 100 million.
quotes.speaker: Blackbeard

quotes.text: Fuffuffuffu! This is boring. Let's liven things up a bit.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo
quotes.context: Before using his powers on Marines

quotes.text: If those two were to meet, it would be too dangerous.
quotes.speaker: Five Elders

themes.description: The episode contrasts Luffy's unwavering belief in dreams against Bellamy's cynical worldview. Luffy's victory proves that conviction and dreams are more powerful than mockery and doubt.
themes.symbolism: Luffy pointing to the sky after defeating Bellamy symbolizes dreams reaching upward despite opposition.

themes.description: Introduction of the Five Elders and the Warlord system shows the complex power structure of the One Piece world, from the highest government authority to the pirates they try to control.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between the pristine Mary Geoise and the rough Mock Town represents the divide between authority and freedom.

themes.description: Blackbeard's introduction brings themes of fate and destiny, contrasting with Luffy's more straightforward pursuit of dreams. Both believe in their path but approach it differently.
themes.symbolism: Blackbeard examining Luffy's bounty poster symbolizes their parallel journeys and eventual confrontation.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows maturity and overwhelming power by defeating Bellamy in one punch, proving how much he's grown since Alabasta. His calm demeanor and focus on helping Cricket demonstrates character growth.
keyActions: Confronts Bellamy calmly demanding Cricket's gold
Defeats Bellamy with a single devastating punch
Points to the sky affirming belief in dreams
Retrieves the stolen gold for Cricket

characterSpotlights.development: Blackbeard makes his first physical appearance, establishing his interest in high-bounty pirates and his mysterious plans. His calm confidence and strategic thinking are immediately apparent.
keyActions: Examines Luffy's bounty poster with interest
Reveals he's hunting someone worth 100 million
Discusses fate and destiny with his crew
Leaves Mock Town with his crew for their secret plan
quotes: I'm not interested in capturing weaklings. I'm after one man... one worth 100 million.

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo's debut immediately establishes him as cruel, powerful, and utterly contemptuous of others. His casual use of his powers to torment Marines shows his dangerous nature.
keyActions: Arrives at Mary Geoise for Warlord meeting
Forces Marines to fight each other with his Devil Fruit
Shows complete disregard for authority despite being a Warlord
quotes: Fuffuffuffu! This is boring. Let's liven things up a bit.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the Bellamy vs Luffy confrontation slightly with additional animation of Bellamy's Spring Hopper technique.
Additional reaction shots from Mock Town citizens after Luffy defeats Bellamy.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of multiple characters who will become crucial to the story: Blackbeard, Doflamingo, Kuma, Laffitte, and the Five Elders.
Luffy defeating Bellamy with one punch is considered one of the most satisfying moments in the Jaya Arc by fans, as it proves that dreams are worth fighting for.
This episode adapts content from three different manga chapters: 232, 233, and 234.
Doflamingo's signature laugh 'Fuffuffuffu' becomes one of the most recognizable villain laughs in the series.
The Five Elders wouldn't be seen again for many episodes, maintaining their mysterious nature for years.
This episode has an IMDb rating of 9.3/10, one of the highest-rated episodes in the Jaya Arc.
